text: Pyshka or ponchik (, pl. pyshki пышки; пончик, pl. ponchiki пончики) is a Russian variety of doughnut. ==Types== Pyshki are either ring-shaped or without a hole. File:Пышки.jpg|Pyshki without a hole, Novosibirsk pyshki cafe ==Regional name variations== In Saint Petersburg and Novosibirsk, the dish is called "pyshka" and the cafe is called "pyshechnaya". In Moscow, it is called "ponchik", the doughnut eatery is called "ponchikovaya".6 places to try legendary Soviet donuts in Moscow. Russia Beyond.Pyshki with cognac. NGS. Пышки с коньяком. НГСPyshka, I know you: the taste of soviet childhood. NGS. Пышка, я тебя знаю: вкус советского детства. НГС. File:Donut Eatery SPB.jpg|Pyshechnaya, Bolshaya Konushennaya Street, Saint Petersburg, founded in the 1960sNTV. title: Pyshka
